results.title: Empire of the sun
results.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Frank Marshall, Kathleen Kennedy, Amblin Entertainment and Robert Shapiro Productions
results.brief_description: Jim Graham, a young Briton living a comfortable life in Shanghai, is separated from his parents following the Japanese invasion of China at the start of World War II. The separation leads to Jim being caught in an internment camp where he has to fend for himself. Cast includes John Malkovich, Christian Bale, Miranda Richardson and Nigel Havers. Based on the autobiographical novel by J. G. Ballard.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steven Spielberg, Frank Marshall, Kathleen Kennedy, Amblin Entertainment and Robert Shapiro Productions

results.title: Bringing Up Baby
results.creator_credit: Howard Hawks and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Cary Grant is an absent-minded zoology professor who needs one million dollars for his nature museum. Katharine Hepburn, in her first foray into real comedy, is an heiress who is determined to get him the money, and to win his heart. However, first she must get him to drop his fiance, find his dinosaur bone which she has lost, and convince him to look after her pet leopard named Baby. An outstanding, fast-paced comedy and one of Howard Hawk’s most loved films.

results.title: Bagdad Cafe = Out of Rosenheim
results.creator_credit: Percy Adlon, Eleonore Adlon, Hessischer Rundfunk, Bayerischer Rundfunk, Pro-Ject and Pelemele
results.brief_description: Jasmin, a middle aged woman from Bavaria rows with her husband while on holiday in the US. She leaves him and finds herself alone in the desert off route 66, somewhere between Disneyland and Las Vegas. After wandering into a shabby motel complex, “Bagdad Cafe”- a watering hole run by bossy Brenda and frequented by a bizarre collection of individuals- an unlikely friendship develops between the two women. Stars Marianne Sagerbrecht, CCH Pounder and Jack Palance.

results.title: Quality Street
results.creator_credit: George Stevens, Pandro S. Berman and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Set in Victorian England, Katharine Hepburn plays the not-so-young Phoebe Throssel, fearing imminent spinsterhood as she watches her favourite suitor head off to the Napoleonic Wars, without leaving a wedding proposal behind. When he returns years later, Phoebe must masquerade as her own high-spirited niece to regain his attention. Also starring Joan Fontaine and Franchot Tone. Based on the play by Sir James M. Barrie.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Stevens, Pandro S. Berman and RKO Radio Pictures

results.title: Bus Stop
results.creator_credit: Joshua Logan, Buddy Adler and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A naive, young cowboy coming to Phoenix for the big rodeo, falls in love with the first woman he sees. She happens to be Marilyn Monroe, playing a “chantoosie” in a cheap bar, and he has to almost kidnap her, get beaten up for her, and perform majestically in the rodeo before she reciprocates his love. Don Murray gives a boisterous performance as the cowboy in the big city, but Monroe steals the film in what is considered one of her best performances. Based on the play “Bus Stop” by William Inge.

results.title: They were expendable
results.brief_description: Robert Montgomery and John Wayne are naval lieutenants stationed in the Philippines who are keen to test their squadrons and equipment in battle. They get the chance to do so when the Japanese attack Pearl Harbour and the US enters World War II. Donna Reed also features as a nurse falling in love with Wayne, but the relationship takes second place to the brilliant staging and editing of the navy and air battles. In the bloody and intense war scenes Ford shows his brilliance as a film director. Based on the novel of the same name by William L. White.

results.title: Night Moves
results.creator_credit: Arthur Penn, Robert Sherman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Gene Hackman plays private detective Harry Moseby who is hired by an ex- actress to find her teenage runaway daughter. Moseby’s hunt for the missing teenager takes him deep into mystery, double-cross, violence and smuggling. A homage to film-noir, “Night Moves” is also a bleak, stylish examination of alienation and greed in contemporary America.

results.title: Duel
results.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, George Eckstein and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: What begins as an ordinary business trip becomes a haunting life and death battle for Dennis Weaver in Steven Spielberg’s highly acclaimed first film. Initially Weaver refuses to believe he is being followed by a huge diesel truck, but soon the unbelievable horror of the situation sinks in. Based on a story by Richard Matheson who also wrote the screenplay.

results.title: The Dresser
results.brief_description: The compelling study of the intense relationship between the exhausted and aging leader of a wartime Shakespearian company, “Sir” (Albert Finney), and his homosexual dresser, Norman (Tom Courtenay). Adapted by Ronald Harwood from his own play, “The Dresser” is based on the touring career of Donald Wolfit whose dresser the author was. A film rich in comedy, compassion and love for the theatre.

results.title: Another Country
results.creator_credit: Marek Kanievska, Alan Marshall, Goldcrest and Castlezone
results.brief_description: Guy Bennett is nearing the end of his last year at a leading English boarding school. His best friend, Tommy Judd, is a Marxist, committed to Lenin’s brave new world. In a school permeated by homosexuality, affairs between the boys are accepted, provided discretion is practised. Bennett breaks this unwritten rule and the humiliating consequences establish within him a rejection of the system that excludes him. Scripted by Julian Mitchell from his own play.
